comments.commentBody:
The ideal birth setting seems to be a birthing center within a modern hospital with a supportive OB and a experienced certified midwife nurse. At the end of the day the only thing that matters is that both mother and baby have healthy outcomes. Although mothers should have a say in their birthing experience, we should also trust trained and experienced doctors when they recognize that things are not going well.

With my first child, I took a Bradley method class that basically bashed doctors and hospitals and made me distrust them. I ended up having a planned C-section because my baby boy was breech. The doctors and nurses were very caring and professional and I had a very pleasant birth and a relatively quick recovery. I also enjoyed being taken care of in the hospital for a week after my baby's birth. While I would have enjoyed having a natural vaginal birth, the health of my baby and me are much more important.
Someone said the "pro life" crowd is extremely concerned with embryos from conception until birth.  After that you're on your own.

I wish the right wing hypocrites would mind their own business and stop trying to have government intrude on a woman's right to make decisions affecting her own body and life. I'm sick of reading pompous, moralizing "experts" who care not a whit about the lives of those who actually become born and have to struggle in a society dominated by special interests whose only concern is the almighty dollar.
Matt 7:16: "You shall know them by their works"
Gosh.  Sister Dolores might just possibly give the Catholic Church a good name...

Really?  Did you know that government compulsory schooling has only been around since the early 1900's.  Some governments had to force parents to release their children at gunpoint.  The Dept of Education goes back to the days of Jimmy Carter's presidency.
Agreed.  Your phrase "shame to the Republican party" rings almost strangely, as if inherently redundant.
Yes , but if he wins the nomination it's great for the Democratic Paarty.  I hope he wins,
Mr. Santorum's ignorance of American history is profound.  That he is a serious candidate for the Republican presidential nomination is a shame to the Republican Party.
Excellent comment! The only thing I could add is that the only left of center senator left-since Kennedy's death is Bernie Sanders.
Well then, if you are in favor of strengthing the Social Security System, how do you feel about the President using it as the source for his tax refund program?
yeah and we saw how that turned out.

Mr. Friedman: We need single payer health insurance. We need to strengthen Social Security, not cripple it and then turn the program over to Wall Street sharks. We need to cut defense spending. You refuse to accept these statements or even consider them in your usual Sunday sermon on fiscal responsibility. You've become a "Johnnie One Note". How can anyone take your seriously if you insist President Obama is left of center? We haven't had a real left of center President on social issues since LBJ.

Thank you for this column. It's an important conversation to have, although I doubt that raising the tax rate on alcohol has much of a chance, especially these days. Maybe it's just an us-and-them thing: easy to revile "them" (drug users) than "us" (drinkers). Booze feels safe because it's familiar and many people experience it safely, while drugs, especially illegal ones, are unfamiliar to most people and have an air of danger about them; yet it's alcohol that does the most widespread damage.

As a long time basketball coach, some of my greatest memories are not the wins or the championships...but singular moments like this! A note to Coach Rob Nugent and the Washington College team; to quote Amelia Earhart: "No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed. A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees. The greatest work that kindness does to others is that it makes them kind themselves."
Well done, Men.

This Comment is for Coach Lavin. I just wanted to send a note of support  and encouragement for your PCa. I have just finished Salvage Radiation and hormone therapy from RP 2 years ago. I hope and pray all continues to go well for you as you recover. Coach Wooden and all of his acomplishments at Purdue and UCLA have been a huge part of my life when I was young boy from Indiana. Have always had a soft spot in my heart for UCLA. You took the program at a tough time and did an admirable job. I've really enjoyed you as a commentator on TV, but always believed you belonged back on the sideline. Many prayers for you, your family, and your recovery. Best of luck to you as you bring St. Johns back to national prominence. I'm a St. Johns fan until you play Mike Brey and his Fighting Irish. God Bless, Mike Bruce

Great team chemistry is so hard to obtain; ruining it is easy.
Good job Knicks (we mean you Dolan).

Win-- There's Hushmail.com, which asks nothing of you apart from what user name and password you want. It's free, but has a potentially annoying downside: If you don't check it for three weeks, the account is dead (although they can resurrect it for you for a fee).
netzero, free and it works well.
Hushmail is great

@ "Google has said it will combine the user data it collects from all of its different products, in effect compiling what an individual searches on Google with what is posted on YouTube, Google Plus and other Google properties."

Which is why I don't use Google for anything anymore. Not for searches, not for translations, not for gmail (especially not for gmail), not even for maps. I loathe social networking and never even considered using YouTube or Google Plus. I might've been tempted to continue using Google News Archives, but they deep-sixed that about a year ago.

I used to have some gmail accounts, but one day I noticed that -- even though I provided no information whatsoever to the Profile, and used another gmail address as my emergency email address -- the system automatically created a YouTube account for me, and included within the YouTube account profile was a statement of my age. They must've tracked it through my computer's IP address. No way to delete the YouTube account, unless I deleted the gmail account.

Anyone out there have any recommendations for free email accounts that don't eat your privacy? I still have some paid accounts, but they're annoying for other reasons (e.g., tons of ads, cumbersome access).

A question for those who believe religiously-affiliated institutions should be required to comply with the mandate to cover contraceptives: If the required benefits included abortion, would you feel the same way?

If not, what principled distinction do you draw between a mandate to cover abortion and a mandate to cover contraceptives, both of which violate Church teachings and seem to raise most of the same public health issues?

Profoundly important and courageous journalism, again.  Bravo! Nick Kristof.  The invisibility of the Nuba people over the past eight months has been a disgrace to the idea of an "international community."

Sorry, but it's election season, and the President is busy buying votes by making sure that gainfully employed upper middle class people can avoid paying for their own social security, via the payroll tax holiday, and that lower middle class people can feed themselves at government expense, even if they are not poor, via permissive food stamp eligibility rules.  There's no money for starving foreigners now.
Keep safe Nicholas!!

Dear Nick,

Thank you so much for taking this risk to let the world know what is going on in the Nuba Mountains!!! Can't thank you enough.

Be safe,
nell
I am sure if no one pay attention to it the problems will eventually aolve itself or die out, either way nothingto see there.

Don't forget::

San Anselmo
San Bruno
San Carlos
San José
San Juan Bautista
San Leandro
San Mateo
San Pablo
San Rafael
San Ramon

And those are just ones near San Francisco.
The President has said lots of "really great things", the issue is what did he do with the overwhelming mandate all of you gave him just over 3 years ago?

David Walker is wrong when he claims that President Obama has done nothing about Medicare and Medicaid. Am I the only one in the country that remembers President Obama's rational for health care reform? At the time he clearly stated that we needed to reign in the rising cost of health care if we are to continue to offer these valuable programs to needy citizens. The Affordable Health Care Act has cost containment as a primary goal. We need to make sure that it is fully implemented.

Social Security is an easy fix, another point President Obama made early in his presidency when he recommended raising the ceiling on wages subject to the payroll tax. Raising that ceiling from $102,000 to $200,000 would guarantee the program's solvency through the 21st century.

Having Mr. Walker in on the presidential debates would be fine with me. Having any intelligent and articulate 3rd party candidate would spice things up. But far more useful would be to have Americans actually listen to what President Obama says. It is getting very tiring to read yet again a pundit wishing that the President would say precisely what he has been saying all along.

Printapons is a deal-of-the-day website that is localized if a certain number of people sign up for the offer, then the deal becomes available to all; if the predetermined minimum is not met, no one gets the deal that day.

A touching story.

Also touching that Don Robinson (Dolores' Ex) never married (no one else would do for him), and visited Dolores in the nunnery for years before he died a few months ago.

And they held hands...

There are Catholics and there are Catholics (maybe a RARE endangered species).
As Mark Twain said, "say what you want about me just spell my name right"
I want to see those studies of identical twins reared apart, one in the US and one in Paris. Only then will I believe that parenting style is really more important than genetics.

I was considering to post something like this but there is really no need. Thank you, no repetition of your comments is necessary. The pundits just love to divide us into two or more hostile camps. The reality is fortunately more complex.

An 'attack of passion' is an old story. Romeo and Juliet had to get secretly married before it was too late. Great story for all ages.

In real life, an abortion may be a choice. And contraception is much better.

Not that 'not rushing' things is a bad idea either. Sorry, I am just paraphrasing your words.

I don't see my opinion represented in either of Mr. Douthat's stereotypes of the liberal and conservative points of view.  I want birth control widely available and abortions to remain legal and safe and rare.  I also value chastity, monogamy, and fidelity and would like to see these values stressed in all sex education classes.  I suspect there are a lot of people like me.  Perhaps the reason that I don't see eye to eye with those who are called "pro-life" is that they are unwilling to allow women the right to choose.  Many want to outlaw abortion, prevent access to birth control, and ban sex education from the public schools.  Although I respect the religious beliefs on which these views are based, I do not want any laws that force the rest of use to accept the pro-lifer's religious practices. Nor do I want any law that forces Catholics to use birth control, sit through a public school sex education class, or have an abortion.
The least we can ever do for those who sacrificed so much and in so many ways -- fighting for the principles this country stands for.
Perhaps we should salute our departure with a fly-over of about 300 drones dropping leaflets saying, "We'll be watching our interests, carefully!"

"The least we can ever do for those who sacrificed so much and in so many ways -- fighting for the principles this country stands for.

Yeah. Destruction, mass murder, idiocy and theft.

The sooner we are out (I mean, OUT completely) the better.

I am not interested in bringing 'democracy' or anything else to Afghanistan. The Afghans will have to decide for themselves. They'll never be as ready to govern themselves as we want them to be to (just a pipe-dream!): and I couldn't care less
what they choose, and when or how.

My parting words will be : Don't ever touch our interests, again!!!

Bring the troops home-- and use the money so 'saved' to help them return to life in the US now.
